item.title: Elimination back-off stack
item.description: Reading The Art of Multiprocessor Programming [1] I came across the Elimination Back-off Stack [2] datastructure introduced in 2004 by Danny Hendler, Nir Shavit, and Lena Yerushalmi. It promises to be a parallel lock-free stack. How can a stack allow parallel operations without going through a single serialization point, e.g. a Mutex or an Atomic? Let’s dive into it. A lock-free stack A lock-free stack, also often referred to as a Treiber stack [3] due to Kent Treiber, operates on top of a lock-free linked list.
